Utterance: Hi! Welcome back! How have you been since we last spoke?
Hey, I’ve been okay, I guess. Tried to keep up with the journaling you suggested.
That’s awesome! How did it go for you?
It was a little hard at first, but I started writing down some moments where I felt good about myself.
That’s a great start! What did you notice about those moments?
Well, I realized there were times I helped someone or did something nice for myself.
That’s wonderful! Recognizing those moments can really help shift your perspective. Did you find it helpful in challenging your self-doubt?
Yeah, a bit. It felt good to remember those times.
That’s fantastic to hear! As you continue, try to add more details about how you felt during those moments. It can reinforce those positive feelings.
I can do that.
Great! Now, how has your week been overall? Any ups or downs?
I had a couple of rough days. I felt really low.
I’m sorry to hear that. Can you identify what might have triggered those feelings?
I saw some old friends hanging out online, and it made me feel lonely.
That’s completely understandable. Social media can often amplify feelings of loneliness. How did you cope with those feelings?
I turned off my phone and listened to music. It helped a bit.
That’s a good strategy! It’s important to find ways to disconnect when you’re feeling overwhelmed. Have you continued with the idea of taking breaks from social media?
I have! It’s been nice not to check it as much.
I’m glad to hear that! It’s a positive step toward protecting your mental health. Now, how about your job search? Any updates?
Still nothing. I’m starting to feel hopeless about it.
It’s tough when you’re putting in the effort and not seeing results. Remember, it’s a process. Have you considered reaching out to any contacts or networking?
I haven’t really thought about that.
Networking can often lead to opportunities. Even reaching out to former colleagues or friends can open doors. Would you be willing to try that this week?
Yeah, I could give that a shot.
Wonderful! Let’s set that as a goal. Also, have you thought more about taking an art class?
I looked into a few, but I didn’t sign up yet.
Exploring those options is a great step. What’s holding you back from signing up?
I guess I’m just nervous about meeting new people.
That’s a common feeling. It can be intimidating to step outside your comfort zone. What if you approached it as a chance to enjoy something you love rather than focusing on the social aspect?
That makes sense. I just need to remind myself it’s about the art.
Exactly! Focusing on the activity can ease the pressure. Would you like to set a goal to sign up for a class this week?
Yeah, I think I can do that.
Perfect! You’re making great strides. Before we finish, is there anything else on your mind today?
No, I think I’m good.
Thank you for sharing your thoughts. You’re doing amazing work in our sessions. I look forward to hearing about your progress next time. Take care!
Bye!
